multiplechoiceresponse.p:
Consider this colloquial (common) statement:
"Any drop of seawater is salty"
multiplechoiceresponse.label: Which one of the following is the proper translation of the above statement into standard A form

choicegroup.choice: Some drops of seawater are salty things
Most drops of seawater are salty
All drops of seawater are salty things
A drop of seawater is salty thing

div.p: The term "any" indicates that every drop you encounter will be salty. So we use the term "all" to signify that in standard form. Be sure to use "are" as the copula and specify the object in the predicate; in this case we use "things" as the predicate.
